p: In conclusion, the rhizome extracts of K. folosia possess in vivo anti-malarial effect against P. berghei in mice. This finding in conjunction with the safety profile obtained from the acute oral toxicity results support the traditional claim of the plant for the treatment of malaria. The current molecular docking study also identified the binding motifs of the isolated compounds showing that knipholone interact with important amino acid residues in the binding site of the target enzymes.
